Index » module » ThreeDNavController

Class: module.ThreeDNavController

Defined in: coffee/ThreeDNavController.coffee

Overview

Class to calculate changes in camera position and orientation. Intended as a testable back-end to a thin-but-difficult-to-test set of ui elements and callbacks.

Instance Method Summary

  • # (Object) normalizeMouseTravel(width, height, start, end)

    convert mouse travel into a percentage of the screen or element width and height; using the width and height as normalized units ensures that resizing the window or element doesn't mess up navigation.

Instance Method Details

# (Object) normalizeMouseTravel(width, height, start, end)

convert mouse travel into a percentage of the screen or element width and height; using the width and height as normalized units ensures that resizing the window or element doesn't mess up navigation. Note that this function can return x and y values greater than 1.

Examples:

controller = module.ThreeDNavController()
controller.normalizeMoueTravel 600, 400, {x: 0, y:0}, {x: 300, y: 200}

Parameters:

  • width ( Number ) — width of situationally-appropriate container
  • height ( Number ) — height of situationally-appropriate container
  • start ( Object ) — x: Number, y: Number
  • end ( Object ) — x: Number, y: Number

Returns:

  • ( Object ) — {x: Number, y: Number} -- units are width and height
